column4: air, bus I am learning so one day the Op's will ask me to join

betas? both have atleast a couple releases out

that's nice, how about looking at them from their latest releases?
unfortunately linux, as a whole, any distribution, cannot even come close to OS X in terms of usability and software availability. That being said, ubuntu I believe is the best linux distribution.
true as it may be Linux and Ubuntu has scored a K.O. this year and with te Badger coming in months - they'll shake it up again
Unfortunately I think you have the reality distortion field set on reverse polarity
all's good in the shell - I get paid well to make Mac & Win to work for users daily - but when I come home Ubuntu does my work
and that's great, but claiming ubuntu is some how better than OS X is unfortunately folly at this point in the game
Win & Mac make me a living - true
True Indeed
what brings you to Ubuntu?

cool just asking

ubuntu, at this point, seems like the best all-around linux distribution
